page.title: 14William Penn in Chorleywood
page.content: William Penn was born in London in 1644 and became famous for his Quaker beliefs and the founding of the state of Pennsylvania. However he had many connections with the local area and in Chorleywood two local buildings are of particular note. THE MANOR HOUSE opposite Christ Church on the A404 was originally known as Meeting House Farm and was a meeting house for local Quakers including Penn. Behind the house is a small burial ground. PENN FARM is a Tudor Building on the corner of Shepherds Lane and Berry Lane. Known to be a Protestant meeting place during the English Civil War it is the house where William Penn was married to Guilelma Springett.
